Package gui

Class GUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • gui.GUI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ComponentListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
    public class GUI
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.awt.event.ComponentListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener
    gui.GUI: - Extends JFrame and Implements Component Listener. - The GUI controls the flow and state of the in-game mechanics. - CluedoGame controls setup as user info and player numbers are needed there.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • GUI

        public GUI​(CluedoGame aCluedoGame)
        GUI: - Constructs a JFrame adding a component listener and setting up the size and stability of the game frame. - Holds a private final of CluedoGame to parse UI entered information to and from the games main controller
        Parameters:
        aCluedoGame - - The CluedoGame Object that created this GUI JFrame.

    • Method Detail

      • addLayoutComponents

        public void addLayoutComponents()
        addLayoutComponents: - Creates a Canvas and Control JPanels, adding them to the JFrame.

      • mainMenu

        public void mainMenu()
        mainMenu: - Displays the main menu by calling the canvas and controls to represent the necessary components to do so.

      • howManyPlayers

        public void howManyPlayers()
        howManyPlayers: - Displays the first part of the game, how many players are playing. This invokes canvas and controls to display relevant information.

      • createUser

        public void createUser()
        createUser: - Displays the user creation menu for each player by invoking the relevant components to show on the canvas and controls.

      • selectCharacter

        public void selectCharacter()
        selectCharacter: - Invoked after gui.createUser has run. Links the created user to a character in the game. This method invokes the canvas and controls to display relevant information.

      • gameSetup

        public void gameSetup()
        gameSetup: - This is the last state invoked from the parent CludeoGame. gameSetup invokes the controls panel to add extra control panels to it finalise the creation of the game. Players are set and the game can start afterwards.

      • runGUI

        public void runGUI()
        runGUI: - This state is now the only state being run in game.CluedoGame. it controls which method to run (and thus display) based on the GUIState of this GUI. From here the GUI is now independent of the game.CluedoGame and dictates the displayed screen based on the actions it encounters. This also means upon resizing the screen, the GUI will refresh and resize at it's last known method to run.

      • newPlayer

        public void newPlayer()
        newPlayer: - Called when a players turn has ended, will refresh the screen so that the next player can start their turn.

      • gameMenu

        public void gameMenu()
        gameMenu: - Called when the player hasn't finished their turn but is returning to their game menu. Similar to the gui.newPlayer method, however this maintains the current player

      • showHand

        public void showHand()
        showHand: - Invokes the canvas to represent the players hand they've been delt. Will call the controls backOption to give the user a chance to go back to their game menu.

      • showDetectiveCards

        public void showDetectiveCards()
        showDetectiveCards: - Invokes the canvas to represent a view of all the cards, and highlights the which cards the player has seen.

      • accuseOrSuggest

        public void accuseOrSuggest​(boolean suggestion)
        accuseOrSuggest: - Invokes the canvas and controls to allow the player to make a suggestion or accusation.
        Parameters:
        suggestion - - boolean to determine if a suggestion of accusation.

      • printError

        public void printError()
        printError: Prints an error that the user has made, i.e trying to move to a place they can not.

      • redrawDice

        public void redrawDice()
        redrawDice: - Invoked to update the displayed players moves after they have made a move.

      • confirmShowHiddenContent

        public void confirmShowHiddenContent()
        confirmShowHiddenContent: - Step 1/4: Confirms that another users cards will be shown to refute a claim/suggestion. This invokes the canvas and controls relevant methods.

      • chooseHiddenPlayerCard

        public void chooseHiddenPlayerCard()
        chooseHiddenPlayerCard: - Step 2/4: Gets the card from the other player to be shown to the accuser. This invokes the canvas and controls relevant methods.

      • confirmShowOtherPlayerCard

        public void confirmShowOtherPlayerCard()
        confirmShowOtherPlayerCard: - Step 3/4: Confirm that the card the other player has chosen is ready to be seen by the right player. This invokes the canvas and controls relevant methods.

      • showUserOtherPlayerCard

        public void showUserOtherPlayerCard()
        showUserOtherPlayerCard: - Step 4/4: Show the accuser the card that refutes their suggestion. This invokes the canvas and controls relevant methods.

      • noSuggestions

        public void noSuggestions()
        noSuggestions: - Invoked when this player has made a claim that can not be refuted by any other player. This invokes the canvas and controls relevant methods.

      • infeasibleMove

        public void infeasibleMove()
        infeasibleMove: - Invoked when the player is attempting a move that is not allowed due to some rule of the game: 1) Can not retrace your steps this turn. 2) Must move within distance of you dice roll. 3) You can not land or walk over a player, or weapon.

      • displayRules

        public void displayRules()
        displayRules: - Invoked when a user selects 'Rules' from the menu bar.

      • checkAccusationOrSuggestion

        public void checkAccusationOrSuggestion​(Sprite.SpriteAlias s,
                                        Weapon.WeaponAlias w,
                                        Room.RoomAlias r,
                                        boolean suggestion)
        checkAccusationOrSuggestion: - Creates a popup dialog that confirms the players suggestion
        Parameters:
        s - - The Sprite's Alias being accused
        w - - The Weapons's Alias being accused
        r - - The Rooms's Alias being accused
        suggestion - - (True) a suggestion, (False) an accusation

      • skipUser

        public void skipUser​(User user)
        skipUser: - When a player has lost the game, upon their turn, display via a pop up dialog that their turn has been skipped.
        Parameters:
        user - - The user who's turn is skipped

      • displayWinner

        public void displayWinner()
        displayWinner: - Displays a pop up window when a user has won the game.

      • displayLoser

        public void displayLoser()
        displayLoser: - Invoke when a player incorrectly makes an accusation. Creates a pop up window to inform that user they have lost

      • restartGame

        public boolean restartGame()
        restartGame: - Invokes a pop up menu to confirm restarting the game
        Returns:
        boolean - whether to restart the

      • exitGame

        public boolean exitGame()
        exitGame: - Invokes a pop up menu to confirm the player wants to exit the game.
        Returns:
        boolean - whether to exit or not
